The visitors have been very flat and lacked creativity in their attack. Let's see if they change something in the second period.

45:59 Caption: What a terrific football game that was, with everything included. The home side dominated today's game. The home team made a lot of passes and attempted to maintain possession. The away side's tactic was counter-attacking.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Real Madrid delivered a stunning performance against Granada, clinching an emphatic 5-0 victory at the Santiago Bernabeu in a match that enthralled the 71,184 spectators in attendance. The goals came thick and fast, with Karim Benzema and Isco pulling the strings in a game where the visitors struggled to keep up. 

The first half began with Granada kicking off right at the 12th second. However, the early minutes of play were punctuated with frequent interruptions due to the ball going out of play several times, and both teams engaged in numerous throw-ins. Real Madrid quickly imposed themselves on the game, showcasing their high pressing and attacking prowess.

In the 11th minute, Benzema received a crisp cross from Isco inside the box but a brave Granada defender managed to intercept it. Yet, only seconds later, Benzema turned provider, executing a precise pass to Isco who rifled a low shot into the net, making it 1-0 to Real Madrid.

Granada's attempt at a quick response fell short as they found themselves stifled by Real Madrid's resilient defence. Madrid continued to pile on the pressure, with Ronaldo and Benzema unleashing shots that either sailed over the bar or were blocked by the vigilant Granada goalkeeper, Guillermo Ochoa. By the 20th minute, Benzema capitalized on a rebound after Ochoa's heroic save from a Modric strike. Benzema was well-positioned inside the box to fire low into the left post, extending Madrid's lead to 2-0.

Real's relentless push saw Ronaldo and Marcelo persistently threatening the Granada defence. In the 26th minute, Marcelo whipped in an impeccable cross which Ronaldo, leaping high, connected with a powerful header into the top-right corner, leaving Ochoa no chance and putting Madrid comfortably in the driving seat at 3-0.

Granada struggled to find any rhythm and were denied any clear chances due to Madrid's defensive solidity. Modric and Carvajal kept the pressure alive, and in the 31st minute, Modric’s pass to Isco was finished with aplomb into the bottom left corner, pushing Madrid's lead to 4-0. Granada seemed unable to cope with Madrid's fluidity, power, and precision.

Just a few minutes later, Granada tried to mount an offensive, sending crosses into the box, but they were easily dealt with or went wayward. By the time the half-time whistle blew, Granada had managed only one shot off-target compared to Madrid's bombardment and consistent goal-scoring efforts.

The second half saw Real Madrid make a substitution, with James Rodriguez replacing Toni Kroos while resuming from kick-off. Real Madrid maintained their attacking intent as Benzema tried a mid-range shot that was comfortably saved by Ochoa. The visitors continued to flounder in the face of Real's high tempo and well-coordinated play.

Granada’s brief spell of possession resulted in Franck Tabanou taking a long shot, which was easily dealt with by Keylor Navas, who had a relatively quiet game. Another significant substitution saw Marco Asensio replace the influential Isco. While Granada attempted to keep possession and build play, their moves frequently broke down due to Madrid’s high-press and interceptions.

In the 13th minute mark of the second half, out of a free-kick sent in by Rodriguez, Casemiro latched onto it and smashed it confidently into the bottom-left corner, adding to Granada’s woes and setting the score at 5-0. From that point, Granada seemed to resignly defend against being overwhelmed further.

Despite several substitutions to stem the tide, Granada’s options were limited as Madrid's defence remained impermeable. Uche Agbo's aggressive play earned him a yellow card for bringing down his opponent roughly, becoming one of the few notable mentions in instead lacklustre presence.

The latter part of the game was a mixture of frustrated efforts from Granada and dominance from Madrid, whose players like Coentrao, Benzema, Rodriguez, and Ronaldo continuously tried to make it an even higher margin. James Rodriguez was particularly bright, drawing a splendid save from Ochoa with a darting run into the penalty area followed by a well-aimed shot. 

However, Granada did have a late flurry, including a notable moment where Kravets received a pass inside the box and shot at the left post, forcing Navas into action to refuse a consolation goal. But this couldn’t alleviate their crushing defeat as the final whistle blew.

Real Madrid’s fluidity, tactical nous, and overall in-game intelligence were at display, along with the seamless cohesion among the players. Their ability to intercept passes, win possession, and make quick offensive transitions showcased why they are considered one of the best teams globally. The victory not only demonstrated their attacking riches but also highlighted their defensive stability, with Casemiro and Marcelo playing key roles in their tactical setup.

Granada, on the other hand, were left with much to ponder. Their lack of creativity and defensive frailties were glaring, and their substitutions, unfortunately, didn’t make a significant impact against a rampant Madrid side. They were caught offside several times and their passing accuracy left much to be desired.

In summary, Real Madrid’s 5-0 victory was a masterclass in football excellence, blending individual flair with team ethos. Goals from Isco, Benzema, Ronaldo, and Casemiro none-of-less re-emphasized their standing, encapsulating a dominant team display, effectively evident from the very first minute to the last.  This powerful performance surely delighted the home fans who will look forward to even greater exploits from their side in the matches to attend. Granada will need to revisit their tactical framework and perhaps bring greater creativity and defensive rigidity as they move forward.
